title: Shivamogga prison inmate swallows mobile phone; undergoes surgery
content: Shivamogga district court convicted Doulath in a case related to drug peddling in June 2024. He has been sentenced to 10 years rigorous imprisonment

title: Assam Rifles seize illegal meth tablets worth ₹112.4 Crore in Mizoram’s Champhai District
content: The recovered item was handed over to the Police Department, in Zokhawthar town of Mizoram for further investigation and legal proceedings

title: Anti-narcotics EAGLE teams raid paan, kirana shops near colleges, seize tobacco, gutkha products
content: Over 6,000 shops raided under ‘Operation Safe Campus Zone’ in the last few days in State and booked cases under COPTA Act, says IGP Ake Ravi Krishna

title: Security heightened at Patna airport after 'hoax' bomb threat
content: “A bomb threat was received on the airport director's email ID at 9 p.m. on July 11. Soon after this, a meeting of the Bomb Threat Assessment Committee was convened...

title: Eight-year-old Namibian female cheetah Nabha dies following injury at Kuno National Park
content: The cheetah was reportedly injured during a possible hunting attempt inside a soft-release boma (enclosure) at KNP

title: TNPSC to debar question setters for politically controversial or communally sensitive questions: Chairman
content: Results of the Group IV examination held on Saturday will be released in three months for the recruitment of over 4,000 candidates, while the much-awaited Group II and IIA exam notification by the TNPSC is expected next week

title: Vizhinjam Seaport marks first anniversary; second phase extension to begin by September
content: Although the formal commercial commissioning of the port took place on December 3, 2024, the port began its limited-scale operations on July 12, 2024, after a ceremonial reception for the first mother vessel.

title: MSCB scam: Enforcement Directorate charge sheet names NCP(SP) MLA Rohit Pawar as accused
content: The charge sheet was moved before a special MPs MLA court in Mumbai, though details of it were not immediately available

title: Go abroad for studies on scholarships, do not put pressure on family finances, says CJI Gavai
content: Indian legal system has been facing unique challenges and is badly in need of fixing, Justice Gavai said

title: Union Minister Chirag Paswan receives death threat
content: Patna Cyber Crime Police Station has registered the case under section 66-F of IT Act which deals with cyber terrorism and 351 (2) of BNS (Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita) which deals with criminal intimidation

title: Visa screening does not stop after a visa is issued: U.S. Embassy
content: U.S. embassy had warned that “falsifying or omitting information” related to social media accounts could lead to visa denial and future visa ineligibility

title: UNESCO World Heritage status granted to 12 forts
content: The list of forts includes, Raigad, Pratapgad, Panhala, Shivneri, Lohgad, Salher, Sindhudurg, Suvarnadurg, Vijaydurg, and Khanderi in Maharashtra, and Gingee in Tamil Nadu

title: A malayalam lesson turned into a play by students of a school in Ernakulam
content: The instant play had to based on a theme provided by NCERT and had to be staged without props, costume or music by the students in uniform.

title: Murdered tennis player Radhika Yadav had no academy, trained aspirants by booking courts: Police
content: The girl’s father repeatedly said that he did not want his daughter to earn through training, said an inspector

title: Another batch of over 6,600 pilgrims leaves for Amarnath shrine
content: The pilgrims, including 1,462 women, 41 children and 181 sadhus and sadhvis, left for the twin base camps of Nunwan-Pahalgam in Anantnag and Baltal in Ganderbal in two separate convoys under tight security

title: IMD issues yellow alert for heavy rains in parts of Jharkhand from July 13-15
content: The ‘yellow alert’ has been issued for parts of Gumla, Khunti, Simdega, Saraikela-Kharswan, East and West Singhbhum districts on July 13

title: PM Modi highlights government’s focus on generating employment
content: After distributing 51,000 appointment letters, PM Modi said the whole world now recognises the strength of India’s demography and democracy

title: Student of IIM Calcutta arrested for allegedly raping a woman on campus
content: This development comes within a month of the alleged gang rape and assault on a 24-year-old student in the premises of the South Calcutta Law College

title: Pakistan looks to formulate stricter regulations for foreign satellite operators
content: The regulations are being finalised by the Pakistan Space Activities Regulatory Board (PSARB), based on industry feedback gathered during a recent roundtable discussion

title: Grocery shop owner shot dead in Patna
content: The incident took place on Friday (July 11) evening, and the deceased has been identified as Vikram Jha

title: Radhika Yadav case: Co-actor denies link to tennis player’s murder, says never met her after music video
content: Inam-ul-Haq said he met Radhika during the Tennis Premier League in Delhi, and later worked with her on a music video

title: Tamil Nadu’s Gingee Fort inscribed as UNESCO World Heritage Site
content: Known as the ‘Troy of the East’, the Gingee Fort is part of the Maratha Military Landscapes, and the only aspirant from Tamil Nadu for the World Heritage Site tag

title: Kochi Corporation banking on six additional trained dog catchers to be allotted to improve the functioning of ABC unit
content: The ABC unit is also banking on the imminent arrival of two more vehicles, which BPCL-Kochi Refinery has agreed to fund, thus increasing the vehicle fleet of the unit to three

title: Flood level in Godavari rising, control rooms opened in Eluru district
content: Water level at Bhadrachalam was at 40.90 feet, officials discharged 8.19 lakh Cusecs to the downstream, says the CWC officials

title: Vadodara bridge collapse: Search operation continues for fourth day; death toll rises to 20
content: Officials stated that, in addition to searching for the missing individual, they would also work on removing the collapsed bridge’s main slab and submerged vehicles from the river

title: Bombay High Court dismisses contempt plea against Nawab Malik by Sameer Wankhede’s father
content: The petition alleged that Mr. Malik had breached an undertaking given to the court in December 2021, in which he had assured he would refrain from making defamatory or objectionable statements against the Wankhede family.

title: Fadnavis, mountaineers hail inclusion of Shivaji Maharaj's forts in UNESCO World Heritage List
content: The decision to include 12 forts in the UNESCO World Heritage List was taken during the 47th session of the World Heritage Committee (WHC) held in Paris

title: Ahmedabad Air India plane crash: What is a ram air turbine: Explained
content: Most RATs deploy automatically if there is a major power failure, but pilots can also deploy them manually if required

title: AP Chambers seeks curbs on raw human hair exports to China
content: In a representation to the CM on July 11, AP Chambers president Potluri Bhaskar Rao stated that the demand for non - remy hair had gone up exponentially in the last two decad

title: Varsha Deshpande honoured with 2025 U.N. Population Award for advancing gender equality
content: The Maharashtra-based women’s rights activist was awarded for her pioneering work on gender equality and combating gender-biased sex selection in India

title: Kattige muhurtha for paryaya of Shiroor Mutt on July 13
content: As part of the ritual, 25 truck loads of firewood will be collected and stacked in the shape of chariot on the north-eastern side of Madhwa Sarovara.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Black box data was recovered using NTSB kit that arrived 11 days post-crash
content: The AAIB’s new black box lab can retrieve data and conduct thorough analyses of accidents and incidents, but it is not clear whether it was equipped to recover the same after a crash like this one

title: LeBron to Luka: Inside the most delicate superstar transition in NBA history
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: M's Raleigh hits 2 more HRs, brings total to 38
content: Cal Raleigh hit his 37th and 38th home runs to move within one of Barry Bonds' 2001 record for homers before the All-Star break.

title: Bellinger goes deep for 3rd time after Cubs rob HR
content: Cody Bellinger hit three homers against his former team as the Yankees routed the Chicago Cubs 11-0 on Friday night for their fifth straight victory.

title: Trinity OC's 8-year-old daughter dies in TX floods
content: Trinity University said on Friday that 8-year-old Kellyanne Lytal, the daughter of Tigers offensive coordinator Wade Lytal, was confirmed dead after being missing since the Guadalupe River floods hit Texas last week.

title: Taylor def. Serrano for 3rd time to retain title
content: Katie Taylor won a majority decision against Amanda Serrano to retain her undisputed super lightweight championship.

title: Fever bounce back behind 'floor general' Clark
content: The Fever got back on track Friday against the Dream despite another poor shooting effort from Caitlin Clark, who still keyed Indiana's offense with her playmaking.

title: Turner: Move to Bucks about 'staying competitive'
content: Myles Turner said a big factor in leaving the Pacers to sign with the Bucks was about "staying competitive."

title: QB Retzlaff announces his withdrawal from BYU
content: Jake Retzlaff announced on Friday that he's withdrawing from BYU, formally initiating his transfer process from the school.

title: Amanda Anisimova vs. Iga Swiatek: Who will win the Wimbledon title?
content: It's down to Amanda Anisimova and Iga Swiatek -- each in their first Wimbledon final. Our experts pick who will win it all.

title: Why the NFLPA mess should matter to football fans
content: It behooves the competitive balance of the NFL to have strong ownership and strong labor, Wetzel writes.

title: Who are the NFL's best tight ends? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Execs, coaches, scouts and players from around the NFL ranked their top 10 tight ends in our annual summer series.

title: MLB mock draft 3.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first two rounds
content: The MLB draft is Sunday! And this year, the drama starts with the Washington Nationals at the No. 1 pick.

title: Inside the shift in evaluating MLB draft catching prospects
content: MLB's 2023 rules changes are influencing how the position is taught, played, coached and scouted at all levels.

title: Liverpool retire No. 20 jersey in memory of Jota
content: Liverpool have confirmed they will retire the No. 20 shirt in honour of forward Diogo Jota, who died in a car crash alongside brother André Silva last week.

title: PSG's 'team of stars' look to cap historic season
content: Luis Enrique said Paris Saint-Germain's "team of stars" can deliver the "icing on the cake" for their incredible season in the FIFA Club World Cup final.

title: Palace out of Europa League amid Lyon conflict
content: Crystal Palace have been demoted from the Europa League to the Conference League after UEFA's Club Financial Control Body ruled the Premier League club was too closely linked to Lyon.

title: Garber: CWC a milestone moment for U.S. soccer
content: As the Club World Cup draws to a close on Sunday, North America's soccer community is celebrating what Major League Soccer Commissioner Don Garber calls a breakthrough moment for the region.

title: Sources: Forest complain over Spurs MGW move
content: Nottingham Forest are set to complain to the Premier League over Tottenham Hotspur's move for Morgan Gibbs-White with the deal now on hold, sources have told ESPN.

title: Chelsea's Enzo: Heat at CWC 'very dangerous'
content: Chelsea's Enzo Fernández has said the playing conditions at the Club World Cup are "very dangerous" and urged FIFA to "change the schedule" at the 2026 World Cup to avoid putting players at risk in the tournament next year.

title: Perfect Spain top group as Italy also progress
content: Spain cruised to a 3-1 win over Italy on Friday that sees both sides through to the knockout stages at the Women's Euros.

title: Sources: Madueke leaves for Arsenal medical
content: Noni Madueke has left the Chelsea camp ahead of a proposed £50 million transfer to Arsenal, sources told ESPN.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Italy run Spain close to qualify; Portugal fall
content: Italy put in a great performance despite losing to Spain to seal the second qualification spot in Group B. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: Fight results: Katie Taylor defeats Amanda Serrano in trilogy fight
content: Katie Taylor outpointed Amanda Serrano once again to retain her undisputed junior welterweight title.

title: The NBA is closing in on its first $1 million per game player
content: The reigning MVP will get close, but the league is still waiting for its first $82 million per year player.

title: Collier has company in MVP conversation; Bueckers takes over ROY race
content: Paige Bueckers has emerged as the top rookie, while MVP favorite Napheesa Collier has some competition.

title: The unstoppable power of Jim Abbott's legacy
content: Abbott, who pitched in the majors with one hand, remains a beacon for families with unique struggles.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Former heavyweight title contender Derrick Lewis is back
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? MMA analysts and former UFC fighters Anthony Smith and Din Thomas make their picks.

title: We graded the offseason: Here's who crushed it and flubbed it, from the Rams (A) to the Saints (D)
content: We handed out offseason report cards to all 32 NFL teams, factoring in signings, extensions, trades, draft picks, hirings -- you name it.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: Colorado's reload, Arizona State's repeat bid, and the return of Utah and K-State
content: The Big 12 had a surprise champion and the Heisman Trophy winner in 2024. What happens in the league in 2025?

title: Georgia to California: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 3 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our third "state check."

title: 'Advisory, not mandatory': Did FAA flag fuel control switch issue on Boeing jets in 2018?
content: A preliminary report on the Air India crash in Ahmedabad reveals a 2018 US report flagged a potential fuel control switch issue in Boeing aircraft. The FAA bulletin warned of possible disengagement of the switch locking feature, potentially causing unintended engine shutdowns. Inspections weren't mandatory, and the crash investigation continues, focusing on engine failure without pilot input.

title: TOI+ webinar: Can your anti-ageing treatment kill you?
content: The death of actor Shefali Jariwala, possibly resulting from anti-ageing treatments, has raised questions regarding the indiscriminate use of potentially harmful chemicals in such procedures. TOI+ gets a panel of doctors with various specialities to explain the risks that come with many of these treatments and what you should watch out for.

title: 'Met on Instagram': Bangladeshi woman crosses border to meet lover from Karnataka; lands in jail
content: Driven by love, a Bangladeshi woman illegally crossed the international border into Tripura to meet her Instagram boyfriend from Karnataka. Their joyous reunion was short-lived as the BSF apprehended them in Sepahijala district. Now, both are in judicial custody, facing charges under the Passports Act, the Foreigners Act, and the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, while authorities investigate potential human trafficking involvement.

title: 'Imagine Kohli playing, his daughter clapping': Raina slams BCCI's family ban on tours
content: Suresh Raina has openly criticised the BCCI's policy of restricting players' families from joining them on overseas tours, deeming it unfair and potentially harmful to their mental well-being. He emphasised the crucial emotional support families provide, especially during challenging periods, and highlighted how their presence can boost morale and performance, using Virat Kohli as an example.

title: Top engineer quits Musk’s AI firm: Joins OpenAI; says ‘Jensen Huang was right, Elon & his teams…’
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: Sexual assault accused 'lynched' in Arunachal: Dragged out of police station; dies in hospital
content: A 19-year-old migrant labourer, accused of sexually assaulting multiple young girls in Arunachal Pradesh's Lower Dibang Valley district, was lynched by a mob outside the Roing police station on Friday. The accused, who allegedly assaulted seven minors aged six to nine, was handed over to the police after a search.

title: Chhangur Baba weeps as Rs 3 cr villa razed; ran conversion racket for 15 years
content: Uttar Pradesh ATS took Jalaluddin, alias Chhangur Baba, a conversion syndicate leader, to his partially demolished Balrampur villa for interrogation. The 40-minute on-site questioning yielded vital documents related to alleged forced religious conversions. Baba, in ATS custody until July 16, reportedly broke down upon seeing his razed property.

title: Change your CEO: Apple needs a CEO who can... say; analysts in investor note
content: LightShed Partners suggests Apple may need a CEO with a stronger product focus, particularly in AI, to avoid falling behind competitors. While Tim Cook excelled in operational efficiency, the analysts believe Apple's slow progress in AI, especially with Siri, poses a significant risk to its long-term growth and ability to innovate.

title: Teen girl foils kidnapping bid in Thane - Here's how she saved herself
content: A 16-year-old girl bravely escaped a kidnapping attempt in Thane. The incident happened on July 9 in Bhiwandi. She was in an auto-rickshaw when the driver refused to stop near her school. The girl used a geometry compass to defend herself. She then jumped from the moving vehicle. She reached school safely and informed her mother.

title: Chess WC: 23-yo Indian stuns former world champion, pockets Rs 5.8 lakh so far
content: Indian International Master (IM) Vantika Agrawal triumphed over former world champion Anna Ushenina in a tie-breaker, advancing to the third round of the FIDE Women's World Cup 2025. Despite some challenges in earlier games, Vantika's focused strategy secured her victory. Meanwhile, Padmini Rout and Priyanka K were eliminated, while four other Indian players progressed to the next round.

title: The Kelce brothers spark viral moment at celebrity golf tournament
content: Travis and Jason Kelce captivated the American Century Championship with their on-course antics, highlighted by a playful jab at Jason's football origins. The brothers' appearance, alongside their father Ed, brought NFL star power and humor to the golf tournament. Their lighthearted interactions and brotherly banter quickly went viral, overshadowing even the absence of Taylor Swift and Kylie Kelce.

title: Microsoft layoffs: Company cuts 15,000 jobs; tells employees to invest in ...
content: Microsoft is urging its remaining workforce to enhance their AI skills after significant layoffs impacting over 15,000 employees this year. The company is integrating AI usage into performance reviews and shifting its sales strategy towards technically proficient "solutions engineers." This move comes amidst substantial AI investments and a company-wide push for Copilot adoption.

title: TN custodial death: CBI to probe Ajith Kumar case; autopsy found 44 injuries, bleeding
content: The CBI has launched an investigation into the custodial death of Ajith Kumar, a temple guard from Tamil Nadu. This action follows the Tamil Nadu government's decision to transfer the case to the agency. A postmortem report revealed multiple external and internal injuries, suggesting torture.

title: ISL season put on hold: AIFF's detailed statement
content: The Indian Super League's 2025-26 season is on hold due to MRA renewal uncertainty, prompting AIFF to acknowledge ISL's importance while stressing adherence to the law. AIFF is restricted by a Supreme Court directive from finalizing new MRA terms with FSDL until a verdict on AIFF's draft constitution.

title: ‘Chicken' dispute turns fatal: Man run over by car in MP; mother witnesses horror
content: In Damoh district, Madhya Pradesh, Rakesh Raikwar, 32, was fatally run over by a car driven by Aqueel following an argument over buying chicken. The incident occurred near Ajmeri Garden, witnessed by the victim's mother. Police arrested Aqueel and seized the vehicle. Authorities stated a past dispute existed between the two men.

title: Connor McDavid coy on future, says leaving Oilers ‘will take some time’
content: Following a devastating Stanley Cup Finals loss to the Florida Panthers, Connor McDavid is contemplating his future with the Edmonton Oilers as his contract nears expiration in 2026. McDavid plans to discuss his options with his agent and family, emphasizing there's no immediate rush to make a decision.

title: Stefon Diggs shuts down BBL claim, addresses Cardi B breakup rumors
content: Stefon Diggs has refuted claims that he called Cardi B "smelly" due to her BBL, dismissing the rumors as false. This comes after Cardi B removed pictures from her Instagram, sparking breakup speculations among fans. Despite the rumors and cryptic social media posts, the couple seems to be going strong, with Diggs posting a video of them working out together.

title: Ayesha Curry shares new photo of baby cat, resemblance to Stephen Is Uncanny
content: Ayesha Curry recently shared a heartwarming photo of her youngest child, Cai, sparking a frenzy online due to the striking resemblance to his father, Steph Curry. Fans flooded social media, pointing out Cai's light eyes and infectious smile mirror those of the NBA superstar. Some even noted a resemblance to Steph's mother, Sonya Curry, highlighting the Curry family's strong genes.

title: Decoy system for Rafale: India to speed up X-guard for IAF fighter jets
content: India is expediting the acquisition of Rafael's X Guard decoy system to bolster the Rafale fighter jets' missile defense capabilities, crucial for operations in contested airspace. The system, used by Israel, lures missiles away from the aircraft.

title: Air India plane crash: What are the fuel control switches under scrutiny?
content: A preliminary report on the Air India Flight AI171 crash revealed a catastrophic engine failure just seconds after takeoff from Ahmedabad. Both engines of the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner lost power due to a sudden fuel supply cutoff, leading to the fatal accident. Investigators are probing the cause, focusing on fuel control switches and a prior FAA warning.

title: 'Delivery ke pehle uthwa lenge': BJP MP’s bizarre fix after pregnant woman demands road; sparks row
content: Sidhi BJP MP Rakesh Mishra's suggestion to admit pregnant women a week early to address the lack of roads in Khaddi Khurd village has sparked controversy. Influencer Leela Sahu highlighted the issue, emphasizing the difficulty ambulances face, especially during monsoon.

title: 'Monica' song out: Pooja Hegde shines, Soubin Shahir steals the show
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' is creating buzz with its second single 'Monica,' composed by Anirudh Ravichander. The song features Pooja Hegde and Soubin Shahir, whose unexpected dance moves have stolen the spotlight. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj and featuring a star-studded cast, 'Coolie' is set for an August 14 release, clashing with 'War 2' at the box office.

title: 'Don't jump to any conclusion': Centre reacts to AI 171 crash probe report
content: The ministry of civil aviation has clarified that the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's (AAIB) report on the Air India Flight 171 crash is preliminary. The investigation into the deadly crash of the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, which occurred shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad and claimed the lives of 240 people, is still ongoing.

title: 'Life is very unpredictable': Siraj speaks about his Diogo Jota tribute - watch
content: Mohammed Siraj dedicated his wickets in the Lord's Test to footballer Diogo Jota, who tragically passed away in a car accident. Siraj, a Cristiano Ronaldo and Portugal fan, expressed his shock and sadness upon hearing the news. He emphasized the unpredictability of life and wanted to honor Jota with his on-field gesture, reflecting the shared emotions felt across different sports.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Judicial panel blames RCB, police & KSCA; Siddaramaiah responds
content: A judicial commission report has implicated the Karnataka State Cricket Association, Royal Challengers Bengaluru, and the police for security lapses contributing to the Bengaluru stampede that claimed 11 lives during IPL victory celebrations. The report, submitted to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, highlights failures in crowd control, coordination, and the issuance of physical tickets without digital options.

title: Another businessman shot dead in Patna: Tejashwi slams Nitish; questions CM's silence
content: Political tensions rise in Bihar as another businessman, Vikram Jha, is murdered in Patna. Tejashwi Yadav criticizes chief minister Nitish Kumar over rising crime. This incident follows the killings of Gopal Khemka and another sand mining businessman. The RJD accuses the government of lawlessness. The NDA counters, alleging the opposition seeks to revive "Jungleraaj".

title: Fuel switches found in ‘RUN’ position: Aftermath of AI 171 crash in images
content: A preliminary report on the Air India AI 171 crash reveals a sudden fuel cutoff to both engines moments after takeoff from Ahmedabad. The London-bound Boeing 787, carrying a heavy load, failed to gain altitude, clipping structures before crashing into a building.

title: Why Pant was allowed to bat at his regular spot despite missing fielding duty - Explained
content: Rishabh Pant's finger injury during the third Test at Lord's raised concerns about his batting eligibility, but ICC rules permit him to bat at his usual position as the injury was legitimate. This contrasts with tactical absences, which could restrict batting order. Pant's return at No. 5 was a significant advantage for India, allowing him to contribute despite the pain.

title: Delhi: Two dead after 4-storey building collapses in Seelampur; several trapped
content: A four-story building in northeast Delhi's Seelampur area collapsed on Saturday, leading to a frantic rescue operation. Several individuals are feared trapped under the debris of the ground-plus-three-floor structure. Fire officials have confirmed that three to four people have already been hospitalized, and seven fire tenders are at the scene working to save others.

title: Bollywood’s richest star kid: Rs 3130 crore fortune, luxury cars, sea-view home
content: Bollywood's star kids often benefit from their family names. However, Hrithik Roshan has emerged as the wealthiest. His net worth surpasses other star kids like Sara Ali Khan and Aryan Khan. Roshan's success stems from hit films like 'Krrish' and 'War'. He also earns from endorsements and his HRX brand. He owns luxurious properties and cars.

title: IND vs ENG: Cheteshwar Pujara to ring the bell at Lord's
content: Indian Test stalwart Cheteshwar Pujara will ring the prestigious five-minute bell at Lord's before Day 3 of the ongoing Test match between India and England. He joins a select group of active Indian cricketers to receive this honor at the historic venue. Previously, Deepti Sharma rang the bell in 2021.

title: Rozgar Mela 2025: Over 51,000 jobs offered to youths in government posts
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi distributed over 51,000 appointment letters to newly recruited government employees during the 16th edition of Rozgar Mela on July 12, 2025. Conducted across 47 locations, this event marks a significant milestone in the Rozgar Mela initiative, facilitating over 1 million appointments. Recruits will join various central government departments, strengthening public service and offering stable careers.

title: Ankita Lokhande shares the secret behind her glowing skin: safron drink and more
content: Ankita Lokhande shares her wellness routine. It includes 'magic water' and supplements. She consumes soaked methi seeds and dalchini water. Her morning also includes aloe vera and saffron water. Ankita dedicates time to prayer. She recites religious texts. She charges water near the temple. This water is consumed throughout the day.

title: India-US trade deal: Trump administration may cut tariff to below 20% - check details
content: The United States is considering an interim trade agreement with India, potentially setting tariffs below 20%, a more favorable position than other regional nations. While many countries face tariff hikes, India may avoid a formal notice.

title: 8-year-old walks again after experimental drug for rare condition
content: An 8-year-old boy, wheelchair-bound due to a rare genetic disease, HPDL deficiency, regained his mobility through an experimental drug, 4-HB. This groundbreaking treatment, bypassing the CoQ10 deficiency, restored his ability to walk and engage in activities like hiking and go-karting.

title: Epstein Files: Will Kash Patel resign? The story so far
content: Conservative influencers, who had banked on explosive revelations implicating elites, were incensed. Bondi’s office had built expectations with Phase 1 of the “Epstein Files” back in February—a series of binders handed out to right-wing media figures that mostly repackaged previously leaked information. With the July memo’s flat conclusions, fury erupted.

title: Bihar: Police bans women personnel from wearing jewellery, makeup on duty; violations to face action
content: Bihar Police headquarters issued a strict order. The order prohibits women police from wearing jewelry and makeup while on duty. This action follows viral videos of officers making reels in uniform. The headquarters considers such activities a violation of service rules. Male officers must also maintain uniform decorum. Violators will face strict disciplinary action.

title: Kanwar Yatra: 'Sanatani' stickers on Delhi shops; VHP certifies vegetarian-only outlets
content: VHP has initiated a certification drive, pasting stickers on shops along Kanwar Yatra routes in Delhi, guaranteeing vegetarian food in accordance with 'sanatani' values. This action follows a proposal to close meat shops, though the MCD lacks the authority.

title: Bihar polls: Chirag Paswan gets death threat on social media; complaint filed
content: Union Minister Chirag Paswan has reportedly received a death threat on social media, prompting a formal police complaint. The threat, allegedly made by an Instagram user, is being investigated by the Patna Cyber Police Station. Paswan recently announced his candidacy for the upcoming Bihar elections, where his party, LJP (Ram Vilas), is expected to continue its alliance with the NDA.

title: ‘Spiked drink, pizza’: Another woman raped inside college premises; one arrested
content: A management student in Kolkata is under arrest. Paramanand Toppaunwar allegedly raped a female acquaintance. The incident occurred at the boys hostel inside the institute campus. The survivor claims she was invited for a counselling session. She alleges she was given a drink and then assaulted. Police are investigating the security lapses at the institute.

title: Both Engines cut off within 1 second: What caused Air India plane crash? 10 key findings
content: A preliminary report on the Air India 171 crash in Ahmedabad, which killed 260, reveals a sequence of engine shutdowns moments after takeoff. Cockpit recordings indicate pilot confusion regarding the fuel cutoff, and a distress call was issued just before the crash. The investigation continues to analyze wreckage and components, with no immediate recommendations for Boeing 787 operators.

title: IND vs ENG Test: 'I don't want to get my match fees deducted' Bumrah on ball change controversy
content: Jasprit Bumrah avoided controversy regarding frequent ball changes during the third Test against England. Shubman Gill argued with umpires about replacement balls. Despite the issue, Bumrah delivered a strong performance, taking 5/74 including the wickets of Harry Brook and Joe Root. Bumrah also discussed his role in mentoring younger players, emphasising on personalised guidance.

title: Andhra Pradesh aims to promote horticulture in one lakh acres under MGNREGS
content: Tailored to each region’s agro-climatic strengths, the initiative is designed not only to create durable livelihood assets but also to generate long-term income for small and marginal farmers, says Shashibhushan Kumar, Principal Secretary, Panchayat Raj and Rural Development

title: Mangalagiri handloom sarees and fabrics: woven in tradition, draped in legacy
content: The symbolism of a Mangalagiri saree today is multilayered — it is a cloth of worship, a flag of sustainability, a badge of indigenous pride, and a product of tireless human craftsmanship; despite their enduring appeal, the Mangalagiri weavers have faced numerous challenges over time

title: In poll-bound Bihar, CM Nitish Kumar transfers ₹1,227.27 crore to over 1.11 crore beneficiaries under pension schemes
content: Beneficiaries include old age people, widow and differently abled persons who received hiked amount. The state cabinet recently (June 24, 2025) decided to hike the pension amount from Rs 400 per month to Rs 1100.

title: Explained | What was the premise of Viceroy Research’s short of Vedanta?
content: Vedanta Ltd dismissed the report referring to it as a “malicious combination of selective misinformation and baseless allegations to discredit the Group.

title: Friday prayers barred at Jama Masjid in Srinagar ahead of ‘Martyrs Day’: Mirwaiz
content: “The sacrifice of these martyrs, and all the martyrs since, is etched in the collective memory of Kashmir and cannot be undone by restrictions and bans. No living nation can forget the supreme sacrifice of life of its martyrs against tyranny and injustice,” the spokesperson of the Jama Masjid said.

title: In Cuddalore, a tragedy on the tracks
content: On the morning of July 8, a train rammed into a van at a non-interlocked manned level crossing in Cuddalore district. While eyewitnesses blame the gatekeeper for alleged criminal negligence, Southern Railway says that the fault lies with the driver, according to its preliminary enquiries. S. Prasad reports on the tragedy, which points to the dangers of the continued use of non-interlocked manned level crossings

title: Working closely with stakeholders: Air India after AAIB releases initial report on Ahmedabad plane crash
content: "We acknowledge receipt of the preliminary report released by the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) today, 12 July 2025.," Air India said in a post on X.

title: Maharashtra govt stays on order allowing homoeopathy doctors to practice modern medicine
content: “The Maharashtra Medical Council is hereby directed to immediately stop the process of registration of homoeopathy practitioners initiated by the Maharashtra Medical Council until further action is taken on the report of the said committee,” stated the Maharashtra government in the notification.

title: India's 'Maratha Military Landscapes' inscribed on UNESCO World Heritage List
content: Its 12 components are — Salher Fort, Shivneri Fort, Lohgad, Khanderi Fort, Raigad, Rajgad, Pratapgad, Suvarnadurg, Panhala Fort, Vijay Durg, and Sindhudurg in Maharashtra, and Gingee Fort in Tamil Nadu.

title: DRDO, IAF successfully test indigenous Astra Missile with Radio Frequency Seeker from Su-30 MKI
content: During the tests, two launches were carried out against high-speed unmanned aerial targets at different ranges, target aspects and launch platform conditions, the Ministry of Defence said

title: People will put an end to dynasty rule of DMK in 2026 Assembly election: Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: Addressing a gathering of party workers following a roadshow on Thiruchitrambalam Road in Vanur in Villupuram district, he says the people are disillusioned with the ruling party

title: Central official discusses simplification of laws with Andhra Pradesh Chief Secretary
content: Andhra Pradesh is at the forefront in making the required changes in laws in line with deregulation goals, says Central government official

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu flags low sub-replacement fertility rate, rising population of the aged
content: At 1.7 as against the standard of more than 2.1, the fertility rate, if unaddressed, can lead to economic slowdown, labour shortage, burden of geriatric care, and widening of the urban-rural disparities, he asserts

title: Air India Ahmedabad plane crash: AAIB initial probe reveals both engines shut down after shift in fuel supply switches
content: The Air India flight’s cockpit voice recorder reveals one pilot asking another why he switched off the fuel supply to the engine and the second replied that he hadn’t

title: West Bengal resident who got notice over citizenship is from Assam, says Himanta
content: The Assam Chief Minister responds to his West Bengal counterpart’s criticism of the ‘alarming assault on democracy’

title: Thousands of devotees in U.P. embark on Kanwar Yatra amid tight security
content: Police set up dedicated control room at DGP’s headquarters for real-time monitoring of route; 8-member team working to counter misinformation; 24x7 patrolling initiated at all major roads

title: Legislative Council passes Maharashtra Public Security Bill; Opposition stages walkout
content: Congress, Shiv Sena (UBT) leaders submit eight-page dissent note against Bill, demand that it be sent back to the joint committee for scrutiny; structure of the Bill is repressive, ambiguous, says Opposition

title: New political contours in Tamil Nadu’s shifting sands
content: The changing political landscape could pose a challenge to the bipolar Dravidian system and the State’s diverse ethos and distinct model of governance and development

title: Verification of Bengali-speaking migrant workers continues, 44 still in custody in Odisha
content: Panicked migrant workers voluntarily approach local police stations to submit documents in Sambalpur supporting their Indian nationality

title: Tapping device planted in my Thailapuram house: Ramadoss
content: The PMK founder say an investigation as to who had planted it is under way and appealed to the people to exercise their franchise with diligence to show the power at the hustings

title: Former Minister Kakani Govardhan Reddy gets bail in Krishnapatnam Port and gravel mining cases
content: Bail petitions in four other cases, including derogatory remarks on social media and illegal quartz mining cases, are still pending in the courts

title: Changes to marriage, succession, criminal, tenancy laws suggested in policy brief to panel looking into issues of queer community
content: In 2023, while hearing the same-sex marriage case, the Supreme Court cited the areas of concern and said the Union government will form a committee to address the issues

title: West Bengal gears up for rare earth mining in Purulia district
content: GSI conducts advanced rare earth mineral exploration in West Bengal, preparing blocks in Bengal and Assam for auction within a year

title: Palestinians are facing joint attack by Israel and the United States: Palestinian Ambassador to India
content: Abu Shawesh accused Israel of committing genocide and said that the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) have destroyed two schools and a university library that were built with funding from India

title: BMTC adds 148 new non-AC e-buses to its fleet
content: With the new addition, the number of e-buses plying in the city has gone up to 1,584, which includes AC buses.

title: Lucknow police files chargesheet within 24 hours in rape case of Dalit minor
content: Seven-year-old survivor’s statement recorded, forensic and medico-legal procedures completed swiftly; officials seek fast-track trial

title: Terror suspect held in Andhra Pradesh an expert at making explosives, says T.N. DGP Shankar Jiwal
content: Abubacker Siddique was apprehended by the Anti-Terrorism Squad of the Tamil Nadu Police. He is wanted in several bomb blast and communal murder cases

title: ED files second supplementary prosecution complaint in Unitech case
content: Agency names Ramesh Chandra, Shivalik Ventures among accused; alleges diversion of ₹7,794 crore out of ₹16,075 crore collected from homebuyers

title: "Too Many Restrictions At Home": Radhika Yadav's WhatsApp Texts To Coach
content: State-level tennis player Radhika Yadav faced too many restrictions at home and wanted to travel abroad for a couple of months to "enjoy life".

title: This New Interstellar Object Could Possibly Be The Oldest Comet Ever Seen
content: A mysterious object, first observed hurtling across the solar system on July 1, has now been identified as "very likely to be the oldest comet ever."

title: MrBeast Calls On All Creators To Join "Biggest Collab" On August 1
content: MrBeast is one of the most subscribed and highest-earning content creators on YouTube and has over 413 million subscribers.

title: Expert Claims Pilot May Have Deliberately Crashed Air India Flight
content: A leading aviation safety expert has suggested that the fatal crash of Air India Flight 171 may have been the result of deliberate human action, raising, for the first time, the possibility of a pilot-induced crash.

title: "Don't Jump To Conclusions": Aviation Minister On Air India Crash Report
content: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB)'s report on the Ahmedabad-London Air India plane crash last month is based on preliminary findings and one should not jump into conclusions, Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu said.

title: "Welcome To Afghanistan": Video Invites US Tourists With Hostage Scene
content: A video linked to the Taliban uses dark humour and surreal imagery to rebrand Afghanistan as a tourist destination.

title: "Canada Not Your Playground," Khalistani Terrorist Threatens Kapil Sharma
content: Pro-Khalistan separatist group Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) founder Gurpatwant Singh Pannun has threatened actor-comedian Kapil Sharma, saying "Canada is not your playground" and threatened him to "take back his blood money back to Hindustan".

title: NDTV Decodes: Engines Shut, Fuel Cut Off - Inside Doomed Air India Flight
content: Air India Crash: According to data extracted from the aircraft's Enhanced Airborne Flight Recorder (EAFR), commonly referred to as the black box, Flight 171 carried out a routine takeoff.

title: "Everyone Was Fed Up": Passengers Stuck For 17 Hours As Couple Smokes On Flight
content: A "disruptive" couple found smoking on a plane forced the captain to divert the flight, leaving passengers stranded in a "warzone" at a Maine airport for more than 17 hours earlier this week.

title: "Only An Evil Person Would Ask": Trump On Reporter's Texas Flood Question
content: US President Donald Trump lashed out at a reporter for questioning the government's efforts on the Texas floods, particularly over claims that timely warnings could have saved dozens of lives.

title: Curfew In Arunachal Town After Mob Killed Teenager Accused Of Sex Abuse
content: A curfew has been imposed in Roing town of Lower Dibang Valley in Arunachal Pradesh after a teenager was dragged out of a police station and lynched for allegedly sexually assaulting minor girls.

title: Major Eviction Drive In Assam's Goalpara To Remove Forest Land Encroachment
content: A massive eviction drive is being undertaken against those encroaching on forest land in Assam's Goalpara district.

title: Indian Legal System Is "Badly In Need Of Fixing": CJI BR Gavai
content: The Indian legal system has been facing unique challenges and is badly in need of fixing, Chief Justice of India BR Gavai said on Saturday.

title: Woman Allegedly Drugged, Raped In IIM-Calcutta Boys' Hostel, 1 Arrested
content: A woman studying at the Indian Institute of Management-Calcutta was allegedly raped by a student inside a hostel of the business school, police said on Saturday.

title: Female Cheetah Dies Of Injuries In Kuno National Park
content: An eight-year-old cheetah named Nabha, translocated to Kuno National Park (KNP) from Namibia, succumbed to injuries on Saturday, an official stated.

title: Iran's Attack On Qatar Air Base Hit Geodesic Dome Used For US Communications
content: An Iranian attack on an air base in Qatar that's key to the US military hit a geodesic dome housing equipment used by the Americans for secure communications, satellite images analysed Friday by The Associated Press show.

title: Radhika Had No Academy, Trained Aspirants By Booking Tennis Courts: Cops
content: Former state-level tennis player Radhika Yadav did not have her own academy and instead used to train aspirants by booking tennis courts at different places, which her father objected to, Gurugram Police said on Saturday.

title: Sleeping Pods Introduced At Visakhapatnam Railway Station: Details Here
content: The facility has been established on Platform No. 1, Gate No. 3 of the railway station and passengers can access the sleeping pod facility without needing a train ticket or even a platform ticket. It is open for use by the general public.

title: 2 Dead As 3-Storey Building Collapses In Delhi's Welcome Area
content: At least two people died after a three-storey building collapsed in Northeast Delhi on Saturday morning.Eight people were pulled out from under the debris, officials said.

title: 'I love a pretty shoe': Paige Bueckers says Azzi Fudd helps her pick game sneakers
content: Paige Bueckers has 11 points in the Wings' 102-72 loss to the Phoenix Mercury . she wore the Devin Booker signature shoe . her former teammate Azzi Fudd helps her pick out her game-day sneakers .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: TCU QB Josh Hoover said no thanks to Tennessee; he's right at home in Cowtown
content: Josh Hoover has a horse, a goat and a couple of steers that he "feeds out" in Fort Worth . he set the single-season school mark for passing yards with 3,949 yards last season . there are few better fits in college football than Hoover .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Mac Allister priced out of Real Madrid move
content: real madrid midfielder Alexis Mac Allister has been priced out of a move to real . the 26-year-old moved to the emirates for an initial €40m in 2023 . manchester united's €75m move for Victor Osimhen is back on the table .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Where LSU fits after landing Lamar Brown

title: The perfect trade deadline addition for every MLB contender
content: major league baseball's trade deadline goes through the same mechanics every year . it's posturing season, but the trade deadline doesn't preclude one going forward . there are so many elements play into a deadline that to link team and player in a potential deal is a fool's errand .

title: Mahomes in Round 11? WRs, RBs prioritized in 8-team mock draft
content: some fantasy football mock drafts are for leagues with 10 or 12 teams . fewer starting slots than in larger leagues, there are notable differences in draft approach . most obvious comes at quarterback, where only five were selected in the first 10 rounds .

title: Power Rankings: Where every team stands heading into the All-Star break
content: the baseball world will pause to watch some of the biggest names in the sport participate in the Home Run Derby and All-Star Game in Atlanta . a number of teams might welcome the reset that comes with the all-Star break . red-hot clubs such as the Blue Jays and Tigers will hope to ride their momentum into the second half .

title: After losing at Wimbledon, what's next for Djokovic?
content: Jannik Sinner beats Novak Djokovic in straight sets to set up a match in the final . the 38-year-old is outplayed by Sinner in the semifinals . Sinner has now won his last five matches against the serbian .

title: Cooper Flagg's first game: Top plays, takeaways and future impact
content: Cooper Flagg made his highly anticipated debut for the Dallas Mavericks on Thursday . the matchup boasted the highest average ticket price for a summer league game since Victor Wembanyama's debut . he finished with 10 points, 6 rebounds and 4 assists as Dallas bested los Angeles .
